intro: Trichomanes punctatum subsp. labiatum, commonly known as the broad-leaf maidenhair fern, is a fern species characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant's leaves are typically narrow and have a distinct, feathery appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocks or tree trunks. The spores are produced in small, clustered sporangia on the underside of the fronds.
